column_data.Payload: {     "source": "Umbrella",     "type": "bundle",       "incidents":[           {               "id": "transient:incident-2",               "title": "MITRE QA Neel: Incident timerange-st 1252 with technique T1586 but no tactic-$ID",               "description": "Adversaries may compromise accounts with services that can be used during targeting. For operations incorporating social engineering, the utilization of an online persona may be important. Rather than creating and cultivating accounts (i.e. Establish Accounts), adversaries may compromise existing accounts. Utilizing an existing persona may engender a level of trust in a potential victim if they have a relationship, or knowledge of, the compromised persona.",               "type": "incident",               "source": "Umbrella",               "short_description": "Adversaries may compromise accounts with services that can be used during targeting.",               "status": "New",               "promotion_method": "Automated",               "severity": "Low",               "confidence": "Low",               "incident_time":{"opened": "$Time"}           }        ],       "sightings":[         {               "description": "DNS request for 'examplebotnetdomain.com' made by 'ksimek-WS' (Roaming Computers)",               "id": "transient:sighting-1",               "observables":               [                   {                       "value": "examplebotnetdomain.com",                       "type": "domain"                   }               ],               "observed_time":               {                   "start_time": "2022-09-13T14:21:20.000Z",                   "end_time": "2022-09-13T14:21:20.000Z"               },               "severity": "Low",               "source": "Umbrella Reporting API",               "source_uri": "https://dashboard.umbrella.com/o/1869975/#/reports/activity?encodedFilters=eyJzZWxlY3RlZERhdGVSYW5nZUlkeCI6MCwiZG9tYWluIjoiZXhhbXBsZWJvdG5ldGRvbWFpbi5jb20ifQ==",               "targets":               [                   {                       "type": "endpoint",                       "observables":                       [                           {                               "value": "41137871",                               "type": "odns_identity"                           },                           {                               "value": "ksimek-WS",                               "type": "odns_identity_label"                           },                           {                               "value": "35.169.125.172",                               "type": "ip"                           },                           {                               "value": "ksimek-WS",                               "type": "hostname"                           }                       ],                       "observed_time":                       {                           "start_time": "2022-09-13T14:21:20.000Z",                           "end_time": "2022-09-13T14:21:20.000Z"                       }                   }               ],             "type": "sighting"         }       ],     "indicators": [       {         "description": "Several activities that reflect Command and Control behavior were detected on the same target in limited amount of time",         "valid_time": {           "start_time": "2022-04-01T00:00:00.000Z"         },         "producer": "Umbrella",         "type": "indicator",         "source": "Umbrella",         "external_ids": [           "securex:umbrella-threat-hunt-c&c"         ],         "short_description": "Compromise Accounts",         "title": "Compromise Accounts",         "id": "transient:indicator-umbrella-c&c",         "tlp": "green"       }     ],     "attack_patterns": [         {             "description": "Adversaries may communicate using application layer protocols to avoid detection/network filtering by blending in with existing traffic. Commands to the remote system, and often the results of those commands, will be embedded within the protocol traffic between the client and server. \n\nAdversaries may utilize many different protocols, including those used for web browsing, transferring files, electronic mail, or DNS. For connections that occur internally within an enclave (such as those between a proxy or pivot node and other nodes), commonly used protocols are SMB, SSH, or RDP. ",             "type": "attack-pattern",             "source": "MITRE Enterprise ATT&CK",             "external_ids": [                 "T1586"             ],             "short_description": "Compromise Accounts",             "title": "Compromise Accounts",             "external_references": [                 {                     "source_name": "mitre-attack",                     "url": "https://attack.mitre.org/techniques/T1586",                     "external_id": "T1586"                 }             ],             "source_uri": "https://attack.mitre.org",             "id": "transient:attack-pattern-T1586",             "kill_chain_phases": [                 {                     "kill_chain_name": "mitre-attack",                     "phase_name": "compromise-accounts"                 },                 {                     "kill_chain_name": "lockheed-martin-cyber-kill-chain",                     "phase_name": "compromise-accounts"                 }             ]         }     ],     "relationships": [       {         "type": "relationship",         "id": "transient:relationship-indicator-T1586",         "source_ref": "transient:indicator-umbrella-c&c",         "target_ref": "transient:attack-pattern-T1586",         "relationship_type": "indicates"       },       {         "type": "relationship",         "id": "transient:relationship-sighting-indicator",         "source_ref": "transient:sighting-1",         "target_ref": "transient:indicator-umbrella-c&c",         "relationship_type": "sighting-of"       },       {         "type": "relationship",         "id": "transient:relationship-sighting-incident",         "source_ref": "transient:sighting-1",         "target_ref": "transient:incident-2",         "relationship_type": "member-of"       }     ]   }

properties.name: Standalone Rule with TimeRange Calendar testStatus

properties.description:
XDR1252-Trigger WF Using TimeRange Calender (all Rules)
Scenarios --
Create Time Range Calendar
Create a Workflow and Create all types of rules in parallel block (Incident Standalone, Priority, Approval, Email and Webhook) with conditions having dates and with during and not during comparison and also have the other conditions as combination 
Verify workflow triggers using rules 
Incident Rules covered for scores lile 1000, 628,494,240.160
properties.display_name: XDR1252-Trigger WF Using TimeRange Calender (all Rules)

properties.script:
import requests

url = "$activity.definition_activity_02G36W9LJHJEN4v0MxyM9ufbSomvjiE2hAa.output.parts[0]$/webhooks/$activity.definition_activity_02G36PTYDHRBD3OqDfPdUAW9eZQzenbowlu.output.variable_workflow_027P5JFQ0SP106SOaK9zDE4KzgITsplp9Tk$"

querystring = {"api_key":"$activity.definition_activity_02G36PTYDHRBD3OqDfPdUAW9eZQzenbowlu.output.variable_workflow_027QB1203EA8L2esNnMu54NvRsQLHdiT14N$"}

payload = $activity.definition_activity_02G36Q3EZMKAY5Hf0ZlXI7RCUDIMf89oKJY.input.source_array[@].Webhook_Payload$
headers = {"Content-Type": "$activity.definition_activity_02G36Q3EZMKAY5Hf0ZlXI7RCUDIMf89oKJY.input.source_array[@].Webhook_Type$"}
response = requests.request("POST", url, json=payload, headers=headers, params=querystring)

print(response.text)

properties.name: TimeZone
properties.description: Time Zone default Mapped to Coordinate Universal time. if user wants changes proper time zone format should be supplied.

properties.name: Provide Recurring Repeats
Provide Seconds to calculate EndDate (defualt is 24 hours)
properties.description:
86400 is default value which is 24 hours. user can calculate required end date and provide seconds for this input. 
Ex -
86400*7= 604800 seconds for 7 days
